qas.question: What was recently added to the museum exhibit?
What was the altarpiece designed for?
What was damaged but cleaned and then conserved?
What was recently subtracted from the museum exhibit?
What wasn't recently added to the museum exhibit?

context: A recent addition to the exhibition is the late <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>13th-century Westminster Retable<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>, <a1_0><b6_0>England's oldest <a3_0><b8_0>altarpiece<b8_0/><b6_0/><a3_0/><a1_0/>, which was most probably designed for the <a2_0><b7_0>high altar of the abbey<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Although it has been damaged in past centuries, the panel has been expertly cleaned and conserved.
